# Analysis of ðŸ’»â”‚developers Discord Chat

## 1. Summary
The chat revolves around Hyperfy's new build mode and UI improvements. Ashxn is leading development of a pointer-lock based building system with features like grab, duplicate, snap, rotate, and push/pull functionality. The community is actively testing and providing feedback on this system. Other significant discussions include WebXR integration for VR support, wallet integration approaches, asset optimization guidelines, and AI-driven collectible items that can scan for and collect resources. Developers are exploring the creation of teleportation systems, audio reactivity, and other interactive elements. There's also discussion about marketplace features, asset quality ratings, and the need for documentation. The development pace is rapid with multiple PRs being merged and new features being deployed to the test environment at play.hyperfy.xyz.

## 2. FAQ
Q: Is it possible to change the color of a material in app script? (asked by Shiffty) A: Not yet but will be possible. Only emission intensity right now for bloom. (answered by Ashxn)
Q: Do we have a way to have secrets in scripts yet? (asked by HPrivakos) A: Not yet but could implement it with server-side access to secrets that are null on client. (answered by Ashxn)
Q: How do I chat with the new controls? (asked by peezy) A: Hit enter to focus chat even while pointer locked, and after sending it blurs so you can keep running around. (answered by Ashxn)
Q: Is there scale functionality yet? (asked by TheMattEmpire) A: Unanswered
Q: How can I destroy an app? (asked by MetaMike) A: Apps can't delete other apps as it would cause chaos, but you can build an app that listens for events to unmount meshes. (answered by Ashxn)
Q: Is there a way I can type in an angle? (asked by Omka) A: Unanswered
Q: Can you support controllers on web? (asked by devilsadvocate.sol) A: The Gamepad API could be used for this. (answered by Omka)
Q: Is it possible to encode objects as it is done in voxels or substrata? (asked by denshipilovart) A: Unanswered
Q: How does the collectron seek things? (asked by Ashxn) A: It triggers perception scans randomly while moving and when searching an area, emitting 'ping' events and listening for 'pong' responses. (answered by MetaMike)

## 3. Help Interactions
Helper: devilsadvocate.sol | Helpee: frabra239 | Context: Learning how to code and understand JavaScript | Resolution: Provided guidance on learning paths, suggested starting with JS/Three.js, and explained how to use ChatGPT to create simple projects.
Helper: Ashxn | Helpee: Saori | Context: VRM file size limitations | Resolution: Increased VRM size limit to 20MB to accommodate larger avatar files.
Helper: MetaMike | Helpee: drdoge.eth | Context: Sharing collectron code for AI-driven item collection | Resolution: Provided full code and explanation of how the perception system works.
Helper: Saori | Helpee: scoe | Context: Needed a copy of the hyperball | Resolution: Shared a .hyp file containing the hyperball.
Helper: Omka | Helpee: frabra239 | Context: Finding V2 worlds to explore | Resolution: Shared links to worlds and explained how to access builder tools.
Helper: devilsadvocate.sol | Helpee: MetaMike | Context: Destroying an app | Resolution: Suggested using app.emit('remove') which worked.

## 4. Action Items

# Analysis of "ðŸ¤–â”‚agents" Discord Channel

## 1. Summary:
The chat primarily revolves around two main technical topics. First, there's discussion about a Blender-related tool that was previously available for download but now redirects to a personal site. Users coordinate sharing this tool via WeTransfer. Second, there's significant discussion about an Eliza agent configuration dashboard for Hyperfy being developed by szjanko. This dashboard will allow users to configure AI agents through input fields and preset options. The interface will support various AI models, though the final list hasn't been determined. The dashboard will offer both hosted solutions and the ability to download character.json files for use with personal subscriptions. There's concern about Claude Sonnet 3.5's inclusion due to its cost (approximately 30x more expensive than other models on OpenRouter). Additionally, a user shared a GitHub project called "Gangland-Genesis" seeking feedback, which appears to be an AI collaboration experiment for Project 89.

## 2. FAQ:
Q: Is the Blender tool still downloadable? (asked by devilsadvocate.sol) A: Yes, but it works better on older versions like Blender 3.4 (answered by ð•½ð–”ð–šð–˜ð–™ð–†ð–“)
Q: Could you share whatever you downloaded? (asked by devilsadvocate.sol) A: Yeah totally. [Shared WeTransfer link] (answered by ð•½ð–”ð–šð–˜ð–™ð–†ð–“)
Q: Is gaianet node included in that model dropdown? (asked by Omka) A: We haven't finalized the list of which models will be offered yet initially (answered by szjanko)
Q: Can it also just generate the character.json to use with your own subscriptions/models? (asked by Omka) A: For both, will have a download button added to it also (answered by szjanko)

## 3. Help Interactions:
Helper: ð•½ð–”ð–šð–˜ð–™ð–†ð–“ | Helpee: devilsadvocate.sol | Context: Needed access to a Blender tool that's no longer directly available | Resolution: Shared the tool via WeTransfer link
Helper: szjanko | Helpee: Channel members | Context: Shared progress on Eliza agent configuration dashboard for Hyperfy | Resolution: Provided screenshots and answered questions about functionality

## 4. Action Items:
Technical: Add download button to Eliza agent configuration dashboard for character.json export | Description: Allow users to download character configurations for use with their own subscriptions | Mentioned By: szjanko
Feature: Finalize list of AI models to be offered in the Eliza agent configuration dashboard | Description: Determine which models (potentially including gaianet node, deepseek) will be supported | Mentioned By: szjanko
Documentation: Review and provide feedback on Gangland-Genesis GitHub project | Description: User created AI collaboration experiment for Project 89 | Mentioned By: Natefrog

# Analysis of Discord Chat in "âš¡â”‚general" Channel

## 1. Summary
The chat primarily revolves around Hyperfy's development ecosystem, with significant focus on the new V2 builder interface and VR capabilities. Community members shared their worlds, discussed technical implementations, and collaborated on documentation efforts. Key technical discussions included:

- VR implementation in Hyperfy 2.0 showing improved performance on Quest 3, with hand tracking and gesture movement capabilities being developed
- The new builder interface featuring a push/pull mechanism that, while having a learning curve, offers enhanced functionality
- API integration work, with HPrivakos creating a solution using app.on(update) as a workaround for the lack of date() or timeout/interval functions
- Documentation consolidation efforts with Omka creating a new site (hyperfy.how) using Astro Starlight to improve searchability and organization of resources
- Discussion of fog implementation in the core engine, with distance-based fog coming soon to help with scale in larger worlds
- Blockchain integration possibilities, including potential for a "Hyperchain" with HYPER as a native gas token

The community is actively building, sharing resources, and helping newcomers get started with the platform.

## 2. FAQ
Q: Is there a dummy's guide to this project? (asked by 3on_.) A: There are some community docs that might help at hyperfy.how (answered by Saori)
Q: Is there any documentation/development in hv2 regarding blockchain integration - like making a button perform a transaction? (asked by treed) A: Linked to a thread, WIP right now. Will update the docs as we move forward (answered by Omka)
Q: Is there a world to study, where there are all functions and can you get acquainted with them clearly? (asked by denshipilovart) A: https://play.hyperfy.xyz - everyone is a builder there (answered by Ashxn)
Q: Is there any token for Hyperfy atm? (asked by Jaewi) A: Directed to #token channel (answered by Omka)
Q: What's the technique for getting those kind of god rays? (asked by mâ‚‚) A: It's volumetric fog in unreal engine (answered by Sceth iii)
Q: What are the environmental plug ins now? Sky box, and others yet? (asked by Sceth iii) A: Basic distance-based fog coming soon, nothing close to unreal yet (answered by Ashxn)
Q: Is there any tdlr or summary of latest updates regarding v2? (asked by Juank) A: Linked to Twitter post with updates (answered by Omka)

## 3. Help Interactions
Helper: VTATV | Helpee: BitFiend | Context: BitFiend couldn't figure out roles after sending Hyperfy world to another wallet | Resolution: Suggested reconnecting wallet to roles channel
Helper: TheMattEmpire | Helpee: denshipilovart | Context: New user asking where to post beginner questions | Resolution: Directed to appropriate channels based on question type and mentioned FAQ/docs
Helper: VTATV | Helpee: denshipilovart | Context: New user getting started with Hyperfy world | Resolution: Welcomed to community, offered to exchange portal links between their worlds
Helper: maximus | Helpee: denshipilovart | Context: New user looking for help | Resolution: Welcomed and directed to appropriate thread for questions
Helper: Omka | Helpee: Community | Context: Difficulty finding and referencing useful content | Resolution: Created zhype.netlify.app (later hyperfy.how) to consolidate resources
Helper: Ashxn | Helpee: BitFiend | Context: Role assignment issues | Resolution: Changed something in the system and asked user to try again

## 4. Action Items

# Analysis of ðŸª™â”‚hyper Discord Channel

## 1. Summary
The chat primarily revolves around cryptocurrency trading discussions, particularly focusing on the Hyperfy token ($HYPER) on Solana blockchain. A significant technical discussion occurred when user devilsadvocate.sol shared detailed trading strategies for meme coins, explaining how to use technical indicators like MACD and RSI to make trading decisions. They described looking for tokens 0-6 hours old with at least 1M in hourly volume and specific trading patterns. The user contrasted this approach with traditional blue-chip trading, noting the potential for 10-40% gains with 12-15 trading cycles per day versus 3-5% with fewer cycles on platforms like Kraken. There was also brief mention of Hyperfy's development plans, including a marketplace for .hyp apps and assets, and in-world $HYPER tips functionality being developed.

## 2. FAQ
Q: What technical indicators are useful for trading meme coins? (asked by Jona) A: RSI with MACD as a secondary indicator; look for MACD gap size and crossings combined with RSI levels (answered by devilsadvocate.sol)
Q: Does MACD consider volume or only price movement? (asked by Jona) A: It's the difference between the 26/12 EMA with a 9-day EMA indicator (answered by devilsadvocate.sol)
Q: Is $Hyper utility about to be revealed yet? (asked by Beats) A: Omka mentioned a marketplace for .hyp apps and assets is being worked on, and in-world $hyper tips are in progress (answered by Omka)
Q: What's a good trading strategy for meme coins? (implied by conversation with Jona) A: Look for coins 0-6hrs old with 1M+ hourly volume, good trading pattern, and trade based on RSI/MACD indicators with 10-40% profit targets (answered by devilsadvocate.sol)

## 3. Help Interactions
Helper: devilsadvocate.sol | Helpee: Jona | Context: Jona wanted to understand trading strategies for meme coins | Resolution: devilsadvocate.sol provided detailed explanation of using MACD and RSI indicators together, with specific examples and charts
Helper: Omka | Helpee: Beats | Context: Beats asked about Hyperfy token utility | Resolution: Omka explained that a marketplace for .hyp apps/assets is being developed and in-world $hyper tips functionality is in progress

## 4. Action Items
Technical: Description: Develop marketplace for .hyp apps and assets | Mentioned By: Omka
Technical: Description: Implement in-world $HYPER tips functionality | Mentioned By: Omka
Feature: Description: Create spaceship models for the virtual environment | Mentioned By: Pete (implied from context about ship models)

# Analysis of 3D-Design Discord Channel

## 1. Summary
The discussion primarily focused on VRM avatar creation, optimization, and troubleshooting in Hyperfy V2. A key technical issue involved properly rigging and weight-painting 3D models for VRM export. Users discovered that V2 requires properly skinned meshes with weight painting rather than just parenting objects to bones. Several users collaborated to solve this problem by joining separate meshes, applying automatic weights, and ensuring proper bone positioning. The conversation also covered optimization techniques like reducing draw calls by combining materials and meshes.

Secondary discussions included hexagon tiling for game development (with mathematical spacing solutions), procedural generation possibilities, and low-poly art styles versus realistic approaches. There were also mentions of upcoming features like improved snap point tools and discussions about animation playback capabilities. The community showed strong interest in collaborative learning through streaming sessions and tutorials.

## 2. FAQ
Q: Why isn't my VRM model showing up in Hyperfy V2? (asked by devilsadvocate.sol) A: V2 requires properly skinned meshes with weight painting rather than just parenting objects to bones. (answered by Ashxn)
Q: How do I parent with automatic weights in Blender? (asked by devilsadvocate.sol) A: Select all meshes *then* the rig, right click, parent > Automatic weights. The rig has to be selected last. (answered by TheMattEmpire)
Q: What's causing high draw calls in my VRM model? (asked by devilsadvocate.sol) A: Each separate mesh with its own material creates additional draw calls. Joining meshes and combining materials reduces this. (answered by Valiant)
Q: Is there a difference between VRM 0 and VRM 1 in Hyperfy? (asked by devilsadvocate.sol) A: Both work, but V2 has additional optimization requirements for skinned meshes. (answered by Ashxn)
Q: What's the correct way to make hexagon platforms in Blender that tile seamlessly? (asked by Ashxn) A: Use the mathematical spacing where hexagons are placed at distances of 2 Ã— radius Ã— cos(30Â°) horizontally and radius Ã— 1.5 vertically. (answered by ToxSam)
Q: How can I add colliders to my models in Hyperfy V2? (asked by carlosmu) A: Use the Hyperfy Tools add-on for Blender to add colliders. (answered by scoe)
Q: What's better for web experiences - low poly or realistic models? (asked by ToxSam) A: Low poly is generally better for web due to performance, faster development, and allowing players' imagination to fill in details. (answered by multiple users)
Q: Can I do procedural generation in Hyperfy? (asked by Pablo) A: Yes, code can be used to generate content procedurally. (answered by maximus)

## 3. Help Interactions
Helper: Valiant | Helpee: devilsadvocate.sol | Context: VRM model not showing in Hyperfy V2 | Resolution: Replaced original armature with default VRM armature, merged vertices, joined cubes, and parented with automatic weights.
Helper: TheMattEmpire | Helpee: devilsadvocate.sol | Context: How to parent with automatic weights | Resolution: Explained the correct selection order and parenting process in Blender.
Helper: Ashxn | Helpee: devilsadvocate.sol | Context: Understanding why VRM wasn't working in V2 | Resolution: Explained V2 requires properly skinned meshes with weight painting rather than just parenting.
Helper: ToxSam | Helpee: Ashxn | Context: Creating seamlessly tiling hexagons | Resolution: Provided mathematical spacing formulas and visual examples for hexagon tiling.
Helper: scoe | Helpee: carlosmu | Context: Adding colliders to models | Resolution: Shared a video demonstrating how to add colliders using Hyperfy Tools.
Helper: ~/HowiEDuhzit | Helpee: Multiple users | Context: Adding snap points efficiently | Resolution: Announced an update to Hyperfy Tools that allows clicking on vertices in edit mode to auto-create snap points.

## 4. Action Items
Technical: Combine separate meshes and materials to reduce draw calls in VRM models | Description: Join meshes and use fewer materials to optimize performance | Mentioned By: Valiant
Technical: Use weight painting instead of just parenting objects to bones for VRM models | Description: Properly skin meshes to bones for compatibility with V2 | Mentioned By: Ashxn
Technical: Position models in T-pose for proper VRM export | Description: Ensure models are in T-pose to avoid animation issues | Mentioned By: TheMattEmpire
Documentation: Create tutorial on rigging VRMs for Hyperfy | Description: Community-led demonstration of proper rigging workflow | Mentioned By: devilsadvocate.sol
Documentation: Document hexagon tiling mathematics for game development | Description: Share code and mathematical approach for hexagon grid creation | Mentioned By: Ashxn
Feature: Add animation playback capabilities | Description: Enable animation playback for creating cutscenes | Mentioned By: á²¼
